definitions.definition: the act of an army entering another country by force in order to take control of it

examples.text: the German invasion of Poland in 1939
Latest reports are of a full-scale military invasion.
The UN resolution condemned the invasion of the country.
The invasion force comprised 3 000–5 000 heavily armed troops.

definitions.definition: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving somewhere, especially people or things that are unpleasant

examples.text: Farmers are struggling to cope with an invasion of slugs.
Robberies and home invasions are grim facts of daily life.

definitions.definition: an act or a process that affects somebody/something in a way that is not welcome

examples.text: The singer described the photographs of her as an **invasion of privacy**.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from late Latin invasio(n-), from the verb invadere, from in- ‘into’ + vadere ‘go’.
